notesStmt.note: This manuscript was likely written in 1891 shortly before the poem was published in Good-Bye My Fancy.
The verso of this manuscript is Department of Justice letterhead.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Grand is the Seen
bibl.orgName: Manuscripts Department, Houghton Library, Harvard University
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

lg.head: Grand is the seen.
lg.l:
Grand is the seen, the light, to me—grand
are the sky and stars,

Grand is the earth, and grand are lasting
time and space,

And grand their laws, so multiform, puz-
zling, evolutionary;

But grander far O unseen soul of me,
comprehending, endowing all those,

Lighting the light, the sky and stars, delving
the earth, sailing the sea,
More evolutionary, vast, puzzling, O soul!

More multiform far—more lasting thou than
they.

body.note: A piece of Whitman Manuscript sent to Bliss Perry 1905 by Horace Traubel
